er_text: An awesome little spot, no if ands and buts about it. The music & wine selections set the perfect mood for a relaxed but upbeat vibe perfect for a Monday night. Thanks for the awesome service Roman and Christine. Will definitely be back.

This is a cool place that my so and I found on yelp and reaffirmed my faith that yelpIs worth the trust. Will is a gentleman and a true and honest representation of what a bartender could and should be. Not only that he fed us cheesecake.

er_location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
er_text: I must have been at 142 Sullivan on an off night. Unfortunately, I arranged to meet friends here without knowing much about the place. It is unbelievably tiny and unable to accommodate a group. The bartender was very nice, but his bar was not stocked with any liquor. He had one bottle of lousy vodka. It was a sad

Such a weird combination of styles. Exposed brick, but it is painted white, then there is stainless steel counters, the floor is concrete, it is too well lit, so there's not warmth to it, yet there are candles. There are those wood thickets, but they're painted white, yet there is a like ivy on the outside, but it is left green.The hell is going on. It is too tight in there as it is oddly laid out.
Very cute spot with nice happy hour and tasty drinks.  Excellent service provided by the young bartender.  I will be back.

Great little bar with awesome bartenders. The negroni is my favorite. You won't be able to stop staring at the old soul train dancers on the TV. If you're looking for a cool soho vibe and atmosphere..check this place out.
Amazing little spot for a post or pre dinner cocktail! Stumbled upon after dinner and we fell in love!
Had a great night there with my girl our friends ended up meeting us there Casey. The bartender was the best
Cool place with a very "experimental" ambient. Great location in a very good neighborhood!The cocktail menu is very interesting with very unusual cocktails.

Friendly, extremely tasteful, and tasty. Must visit. They have Soul Train playing on loop and fantastic art. Bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly. Couldn't ask for a better combination of fun and classy.
Such a cute hole in the wall bar. Peter was our bartender, super personable and fun to chat with. We had a fabulous time and will definitely be going back again soon!

Homey. Small. One bartender. Make this your local digs. A good assortment of beverages and seriously solid tunes. What else do you really need? Just hope you can grab a seat and enjoy the vibes before it gets too packed.

We were looking for a cool bar to grab a drink before our dinner at Carbone and Yelp led us to 142 Sullivan.  Such a fun wine bar with a unique, hip atmosphere, throwback music and nice wine list all with a Parisian bartender - ooh la la!

This place is cute, but is in a compact space, so seating is limited. Also, the pours were pretty conservative for a $13 glass of wine. I would like to come back on another night and see if the vibe gets any warmer. For such an intimate space, I assumed the atmosphere would be more inviting.

A new cocktail bar in the Soho/West Village area,  great for after work gathering. Awesome variety of Lab142 local brew, small selection of wine and a speciality house cocktail. The place is cozy but badly needed an air conditioner for a hot night like tonight! Will definitely come back soon!!
Great wine / cocktail spot. Super intimate, cozy, and  creative drinks. And to top it off, a really friendly bartender / owner (Mils). Definitely a go-to spot :)
Came in out of the cold, Good times, great wine good bartenders woooooooo espech Will!

Love this place! A Yelp find for happy hour one Friday. It is a teeny-tiny place, but they have an amazing wine assortment and specialty cocktails. You definitely want to get there early if you want to get a seat.

Nothing about my experience was nice. The wine was fine but a small serving and overpriced. The bartender was kinda a jackass who pretty much ignored us, except when he winked when we asked for the check. The music was weird. There were slate trays with prosciutto and cheese on the bar, but we were given no direction on whether those were "help yourself" "order me!" Definitely will not be back.I also feel like they don't know how high end they want to be. The place was cute, there was the above-mentioned prosciutto on the bar, but they wanted us to start a tab--- most high end wine bars I've been to just give you the check at the end.

Love this bar. Super intimate and chill. Just down the street from my office on prince & elizabeth. bartender pete is very knowledgeable about the wine and helped my girlfriend pick out a great red. I like to drink red but only while listening to tom petty. Awesome spot to wind down at after a long day while enjoying some wine.
Discovered this place by accident. Tiny, adorable, great wine, and the bar tender was super nice. Will definitely be back.

Loved this little bar but the only reason i removed a star was the amount of space. Like most of the city, you felt cramped and with 20 people this place would be packed. We were walking by and through the windows we could see people staring at us waving us in. We decided to join and when we opened the door, we were treated with a unanimous "Hey!" I felt like we were walking into a modern cheers where everyone knows your name (feel not look). The drinks are a little pricey ($11-$15 for your glass of wine) but I really liked the Cabernet I was drinking. The music was on point!
Very cozy and romantic neighborhood bar with their own 142 beer featuring lager, IPA, cider, light beer and Kolsch.

142 sully. lab142. the room. the old room. Whatever they call themselves now, I love this place. It is my official neighborhood bar, and perhaps the only one left. Only fits about 20 heads maximum and doesn't serve hard alcohol. The music is always great and either eclectic or perfectly old school pop. It is very relaxed. One bartender who is as much hanging out with you as serving you. That means he may be outside smoking when you want to order another drink. Just chill and enjoy the setting. He'll get at you in a minute.

This is the best little bar in New York. The bartender is super hot and makes you feel like you're in his in home in a dope ass house party. Amazing place. Super tiny, lovely, local and tiny. Just great.

I am in love with the ambiance of this quaint little gem! One of my old coworkers called for a ladies night and I almost didn't make it out because it was one hell of a long week. So happy I reconsidered! The owners have one hell of a palette for wine. I have to find the proprietor and thank them for introducing me to my new fave brand of Chardonnay (lioco). I cannot remember the bartender's name (John I think?) was such great company we had a really good time chatting and playing DJ. He was super attentive with our whole group and noticed whenever we needed another drink or water. Super chill, super fun and relaxing spot to get away from the 9-5 hustle and bustle. I think another ladies night is in order soon. Thanks John!
Intimate, stylish, warm friendly atmosphere. This place is the tits. Great soundtrack too. We'll be back soon
Great tiny coridor style bar, stylish and romantic. Lighting is great, we also enjoy the music there.

Looooove 142 so much! Best little secret hangout in SoHo!  Friendliest staff, awesome ambiance, great playlist, and really fun drinks (try the coconut dream!).  Snagged the bar for my birthday drinks the last two years and everyone always feels totally at home.  Such a cozy place!
Amazing and intimate bar with great wine, cold on tap beer, and cool and good looking people

Amazing spot. I was there 4 times in 2 weeks.  Owners and bartenders are really nice and the wine is fantastic.  Plus they have records on the wall that you can choose and play along with free Lucy's (loosies) can't get any better than that!
I love the intimate vibe of the bar. the drinks are great (my favorite is love on the rocks). the staff is super cool & friendly. great space for a small, private party.
We found this little bar on Yelp while exploring SoHo. We had a great afternoon hanging out and Drinking beer. The bartender was friendly and fun and the music was great too. Cool bathroom too.
The crowd is really relaxed, lots of locals enjoying the night. Love it. Small place, big bar, good music, this it how I like it!
